page.title: 11Local History of Exbourne
page.content: We can trace Exbournes' Saxon origins in the names of some of the farms,eg. Court Barton,East Barton.Add to these the acreage of Town Living and Home Living Farms and the total is 436 acres,the original Domesday acreage; valued at half a virgate with 2 plough teams and 13 slaves.The original ten Villein farms have been identified and still exist today. They are Coxwell,Waterhouse,Woodhall,Shilston, Swanstone,Buskin,Yardown,Narracott, Chattafin and Hole.In 1800 Town Living was still divided between 10 occupiers in a Strip field system.It is now one farm. Farm boundaries have tended to remain unchanged as this is an area of small yeoman farmers and squires not Country estates.The cottages have been built to house farm workers and their needs around the central farms and Church.
